nodes.name: sap.ui.export.ExportBase
nodes.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportBase class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to certain formats.

nodes.name: sap.ui.export.ExportHandler
nodes.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportHandler class allows you to export table data from an SAPUI5 application.

nodes.name: sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet
nodes.description: The sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to a spreadsheet file.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Column header text.

properties.name: property
properties.description: Field name or array of field names in the data source feed.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Data type of the field.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the column in characters. There is no 1:1 correspondence between character widths in the exported spreadsheet and CSS units. The width of one character is approximately 0.5em in CSS units, depending on the fonts that are used in the table and in the resulting spreadsheet.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of cell contents. Accepted values: `left`, `right`, `center`, `begin`, `end`. If not specified, the columns are aligned based on the type.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Number of digits after the decimal point for numeric values.

properties.name: autoScale
properties.description: Allows automatic scale assignment based on unit of measure.

properties.name: delimiter
properties.description: Whether to display thousands separators in numeric values.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Text to display as the unit of measurement or currency next to the numeric value. It is treated as a string and has no influence on the value itself. For example, a value of 150 with the unit "%" is still 150 and not 1.5, as a user may expect.

properties.name: unitProperty
properties.description: Name of the data source field that contains the unit/currency text.

properties.name: displayUnit
properties.description: Defines if the currency is shown in the column (applies to currency values only).

properties.name: trueValue
properties.description: Textual representation of a boolean type that has the value true.

properties.name: falseValue
properties.description: Textual representation of a boolean type that has the value false.

properties.name: template
properties.description: Formatting template that supports indexed placeholders within curly brackets.

properties.name: format
properties.description: Output format for columns of type Date/DateTime/Time.

properties.name: inputFormat
properties.description: Formatting template for string-formatted dates.

properties.name: utc
properties.description: Whether the DateTime is displayed as UTC or local time.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: Defines a fixed IANA time zone.

properties.name: timezoneProperty
properties.description: References an OData property that contains the specific IANA time zone.

properties.name: displayTimezone
properties.description: Whether the IANA time zone is displayed within a cell.

properties.name: valueMap
properties.description: Mapping object or Map containing the values that should be mapped to a particular key.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description: Indicates if wrapping is enabled for this particular column.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.ExportBase
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportBase class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to certain formats. This class is an abstract class that requires specific implementations for each file format.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Export settings

parameters.name: workbook
parameters.description: Data and formatting related export settings

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: Source of export data. A data source properties map or sap.ui.model.ListBinding can be provided. An instance of sap.ui.model.ListBinding has to implement a #getDownloadUrl function.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The maximal number of records to export

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: Optional file name for the exported file

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: FileType that is used to identify the file-ending and MIME-type of the file

constructor.description: Base class for specific SAPUI5 export implementations. This class contains abstract functions that need to be implemented.

events.name: beforeExport
events.description:
The beforeExport event is fired just before the export process is started. Listeners may prevent the default action of this event by calling the preventDefault method on the event object.

Since: 1.96.

methods.name: attachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to the sap.ui.export.ExportBase instance itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the sap.ui.export.ExportBase#event:beforeExport event of this sap.ui.export.ExportBase.
When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.export.ExportBase itself.
This event is fired just before the export process is started.

methods.name: build

returnValue.description: Promise that gets resolved once the data has been exported

methods.description: Triggers the export process of the specific format.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancels the current export process.

methods.name: destroy
methods.description:
Cleans up the internal structures and removes all event handlers.

The object must not be used anymore after destroy was called.

References:

  • sap.ui.base.Object#destroy

methods.name: detachBeforeExport

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnHandler
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the sap.ui.export.ExportBase#event:beforeExport event of this sap.ui.export.ExportBase.
The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportBase.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.export.ExportBase with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.base.EventProvider.extend.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportBase.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.export.ExportBase.

methods.name: getMimeType
methods.description: Returns the specific MIME type

methods.name: processDataSource

returnValue.description: - Valid dataSource object or null in case the dataSource configuration is not supported

parameters.name: oDataSource
parameters.description: Possible types are a data source configuration, a sap.ui.model.ListBinding or sap.ui.model.TreeBinding

methods.description: Sets the data source configuration that will be used for exporting the data. If the passed parameter is null, the call will be ignored.

symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.ExportHandler class allows you to export table data from an SAPUI5 application.

methods.name: export

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved after the export process has been finished

parameters.name: mExportSettings
parameters.description: Export settings that are used for the export

methods.description: Exports the data as defined via parameter. The function returns a Promise that will be resolved after the export process has been finished. In case of an error, its message will be shown in a Dialog, and the Promise will be rejected.

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves once the data has been exported

parameters.name: oSettings
parameters.description: General export settings containing workbook and dataSource information

parameters.name: fnResolveColumnLabel
parameters.description: Resolves the label for a particular column that is not directly contained in the export settings

methods.description: Exports the data as defined by the user. This function will show an export settings dialog where the user can define certain settings that influence the output of the export functionality.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils
symbols.description: Utilities related to export to enable reuse in integration scenarios (e.g. tables).

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils.fetchDataSource

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved with a data source obtained from the FileShareSupport module or undefined if there is none

methods.description: Loads the FileShareSupport module and requests available data sources. If no FileShareSupport module is registered or the module does not provide a data source, the Promise resolves without any result.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils.getExportInstance

returnValue.description: A Promise that gets resolved with the requested instance

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Export configuration with optional FileType

parameters.name: mCapabilities
parameters.description: Export capabilities for all supported types

parameters.name: mCloudFileInfo
parameters.description: Information about the file that is stored in the remote FileShare

methods.description: Returns an instance of the specific export class that is evaluated by FileType. The default class is sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet when no specific FileType is defined in the export settings.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils.interceptUrl

returnValue.description: The intercepted URL

parameters.name: sUrl
parameters.description: The URL to intercept

methods.description: Uses the Launchpad Cloud Service to intercept a given URL.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils.parseFilterConfiguration

returnValue.description: Promise, which resolves with an object containing a name property and items array with key value pairs which can be attached to the metainfo in the sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet configuration

methods.description: This function has been deprecated and might be removed in future releases.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.ExportUtils.saveAsFile

parameters.name: oBlob
parameters.description: Binary large object of the file that should be saved to the filesystem

parameters.name: sFilename
parameters.description: Filename of the file including the file extension

methods.description: This function saves the provided Blob to the local file system. The parameter name is optional and depending on the browser it is not ensured that the filename can be applied. Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge will apply the filename correctly.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.FileType
symbols.description:
File types for document export.

This enum is part of the 'sap/ui/export/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'FileType'.

properties.name: sap.ui.export.FileType.PDF
properties.description: Portable Document Format (PDF) file type.

properties.name: sap.ui.export.FileType.XLSX
properties.description: Office Open XML - SpreadsheetML file type.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.export.FileType

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet class allows you to export table data from a UI5 application to a spreadsheet file.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Export settings

constructor.description:
Creates a new spreadsheet export object. Use this object to build and download a spreadsheet file in Office Open XML Spreadsheet format from tabular data. This functionality is normally used together with UI5 tables.

Overview

The class builds a spreadsheet in an Office Open XML Spreadsheet format using tabular data from a specified data source. Data is retrieved and the document is built asynchronously in a worker thread of the browser. The status of the process is visually presented to the user in a progress dialog that can be suppressed. The user can cancel the process with the Cancel button of the dialog.

This class provides a low level API for spreadsheet export. The sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable control implements it internally and provides the export functionality out of the box. For special cases, please refer to details below.

Optional features:

  • Suppress the progress dialog.
  • Suppress worker and run the document generation process in a main thread.
  • Configure the exported file name.

Usage

To start export, create a new sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet object and call the build method. Column configuration, data source, and export settings must be provided in the constructor. The build method opens a progress dialog and starts an asynchronous export process. The export process fetches data rows from the data source, builds a spreadsheet in-browser in a worker thread, and finally downloads the document to the client.

Example: 

  const oSpreadsheet = new sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet(mSettings);
  oSpreadsheet.build();

Optionally, you can attach onprogress event listeners to be notified about the export progress and follow the completion status of the returned Promise.

Example: 

  const oSpreadsheet = new sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet(mSettings);
  oSpreadsheet.onprogress = function(iValue) {
  	{@link sap.base.Log#debug Log.debug}("Export: %" + iValue + " completed");
  };
  oSpreadsheet.build()
    .then( function() { {@link sap.base.Log#debug Log.debug}("Export is finished"); })
    .catch( function(sMessage) { {@link sap.base.Log#error Log.error}("Export error: " + sMessage); });

Example of column configuration: 

  const aColumns = [];
  aColumns.push({
  	label: "Name",
  	property: "name"
  });
  aColumns.push({
    label: "Salary",
    property: "salary",
    type: "number",
    scale: 2
  });

  const mSettings = {
    workbook: {
      columns: aColumns,
      context: {
        application: 'Debug Test Application',
        version: '${version}',
        title: 'Some random title',
        modifiedBy: 'John Doe',
        metaSheetName: 'Custom metadata',
        metainfo: [
          {
            name: 'Grouped Properties',
            items: [
              { key: 'administrator', value: 'Foo Bar' },
              { key: 'user', value: 'John Doe' },
              { key: 'server', value: 'server.domain.local' }
            ]
          },
          {
            name: 'Another Group',
            items: [
              { key: 'property', value: 'value' },
              { key: 'some', value: 'text' },
              { key: 'fu', value: 'bar' }
            ]
          }
        ]
      },
      hierarchyLevel: 'level'
    },
    dataSource: mDataSource,
    fileName: "salary.xlsx"
  };
  const oSpreadsheet = new sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet(mSettings);
  oSpreadsheet.build();

Restrictions

For a complete list of restrictions, see: Spreadsheet Export Restrictions

You can export only the primitive cell data types that are listed in sap.ui.export.EdmType. Icons, images, check boxes, and complex controls in UI5 table cells are not supported.

Custom formatter functions in data binding are not supported.

The size of an exported table is limited by available browser memory. Export of large data sets can lead to memory overflow errors. Therefore, do not use sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet with data tables containing more than 2,000,000 table cells on desktop computers and more than 100,000 cells on mobile devices. Consider a specialized export solution in such cases. For example, MS ExcelÂ® can import spreadsheets from an OData services directly, without any UI.

The export process runs in a worker thread whenever possible. However, code injection to native XMLHttpRequest events is not available in the worker environment. Therefore, the worker parameter in export settings should be set to false if the application uses a mock server to fetch table data.

For exporting hierarchy level information, the maximum hierarchy depth is 8. This restriction results from the Office Open XML standard and the programs that can open such files. The sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet allows you to export more hierarchy levels although they might not be displayed correctly when opening the generated file if the hierarchy depth exceeds the value of 8.

The column configuration must contain at least one column to execute the export process. If there is no column configured, the export will be canceled.

If the export is used within a table, any row that is showing aggregated data (i.E. sum row) will not be exported.

The properties sheetName and metaSheetName on the workbook.context object are limited to 31 characters each. If their value exceeds this maximum length, the value will be truncated.

events.name: beforeSave
events.description:
The beforeSave event is fired just before the generated file is saved to the file system. This event allows you to prevent the default action that closes the ExportDialog and saves the file to your local device. If the default is prevented, the event handler is responsible for closing and destroying the Dialog.

Since: 1.61.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet#event:beforeSave event of this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet.
When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet itself.
This event is fired just before the generated file is saved to the file system.

returnValue.description: - Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

methods.description: Cancels a running export process. This method does nothing if no export is running.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the beforeSave event of this sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet.
The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

returnValue.description: MIME type for Office Open XML Spreadsheet

symbols.title: class sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet

properties.name: workbook
properties.description: Spreadsheet properties object.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: Column configurations.

properties.name: context
properties.description: Export context that will be applied to the exported file.

properties.name: application
properties.description: The application that creates the XLSX document.

properties.name: version
properties.description: Application version that creates the XLSX document.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the XLSX document (NOT the file name).

properties.name: modifiedBy
properties.description: User context for the XLSX document.

properties.name: sheetName
properties.description: The label of the data sheet.

properties.name: metaSheetName
properties.description: The label of the metadata sheet. The sheet will not be shown unless metadata entries are provided

properties.name: metainfo
properties.description: Metadata groups with key/value pairs.

properties.name: hierarchyLevel
properties.description: Name of the property that contains hierarchy level information.

properties.name: dataSource
properties.description: Source of spreadsheet data. Can be an array with row data, an URL, a binding instance, or an OData properties object.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the data source. Currently, only OData is supported and the value has to be set to "odata".

properties.name: dataUrl
properties.description: URL to table data on the server, including all select, filter, and search query parameters.

properties.name: serviceUrl
properties.description: URL to the OData service. Required for OData batch requests.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Count of available records on the server.

properties.name: useBatch
properties.description: Whether batch requests are used to fetch the spreadsheet data. In this case, serviceUrl and headers have to be specified, too.

properties.name: headers
properties.description: Map of HTTP request header properties.

properties.name: sizeLimit
properties.description: Maximum allowed number of records that can be obtained from the service in a single request.

properties.name: downloadLimit
properties.description: Maximum allowed number of rows that can be exported. If not specified, all rows are exported.

properties.name: count
properties.description: The maximal number of records to export. If not specified, all data from the data source is fetched.

properties.name: worker
properties.description: Whether to run the export process in a worker or the main thread.

properties.name: fileName
properties.description: File name for the exported file.

properties.name: showProgress
properties.description: Whether to show the progress dialog.

symbols.name: sap.ui.export.util.Filter
symbols.description: The sap.ui.export.util.Filter class represents filter settings that are used for the export. It provides the capability to have a visual representation of the filters in the exported document and offers convenience functions like sap.ui.export.util.Filter#setType to improve the result.

parameters.name: sProperty
parameters.description: Name of the technical filter property

parameters.name: vRawFilter
parameters.description: Raw filter object

parameters.name: operator
parameters.description: Filter operator

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Filter value(s)

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Defines whether it is an exclude filter

parameters.name: sLabel
parameters.description: Optional label for the filter property

constructor.description: Representation of filter settings that are used for exporting.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.util.Filter.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.export.util.Filter with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.base.Object.extend.

methods.name: getLabel

returnValue.description: Filter label

methods.description: Returns the filter label if available. Otherwise the name of the filter property will be returned.

methods.name: sap.ui.export.util.Filter.getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.export.util.Filter.

methods.name: getProperty

returnValue.description: Name of the property

methods.description: Returns the technical name of the property on which the filter is applied.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Formatted and semicolon-separated filter settings

methods.description: Returns the formatted filter value(s) as string. If there are multiple filters for the same property, which are combined via OR, it will return a semicolon-separated list of the filter values including their operators.

methods.name: setFormat

parameters.name: fnFormat
parameters.description: Format function that will be applied to the raw values

methods.description:
Uses the given format function to format all filter values. The function has to accept a single parameter of type string and needs to return a string value. The function will be called for every single raw value without the corresponding filter operator.

If there is a "between" filter, the function will be called twice. In case of an error, the function call will be skipped, and the raw value will be taken instead.

The format function has priority over the type-dependent format. To reset the format function and return to type-dependent formatting, the format function needs to be set to null.

methods.name: setLabel

parameters.name: sLabel
parameters.description: Filter label

methods.description: Takes the given string as label of the filter.

methods.name: setType

parameters.name: oType
parameters.description: Type instance that is used for formatting

methods.description: Uses the given sap.ui.model.SimpleType instance to format the filter values accordingly.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.export.util.Filter

nodes.name: sap.ui.export.util.Filter
nodes.description: The sap.ui.export.util.Filter class represents filter settings that are used for the export.
